{"id":333035487,"lang":"python3","time":"1Â year, 3Â months","timestamp":1588397563,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"84 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/333035487/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers","memory":"13.6 MB","code":"class Solution:\n    def to_number(self,l):\n        if l == None : \n            return -1\n        cur = l\n        vals = []\n        while cur != None : \n            vals.append(cur.val) \n            cur = cur.next\n        int_val = int(''.join(map(str,vals[::-1])))\n        return int_val\n    \n    def to_linked_list(self,n):\n        if n == 0 : \n            return ListNode(0)\n        n_list = [int(i) for i in str(n)]\n        prev = None\n        \n        for i in n_list[::-1]:\n            cur = ListNode(i)\n            if prev != None :\n                prev.next = cur\n            elif prev == None :\n                first = cur\n            prev = cur    \n            \n        return first\n        \n    def addTwoNumbers(self, l1: ListNode, l2: ListNode) -> ListNode:\n        n1 = self.to_number(l1)\n        n2 = self.to_number(l2)\n        if n1 == -1 and n2 == -1 : \n            return None\n        if n1 == -1 : \n            n1 = 0\n        if n2 == -1 : \n            n2 = 0 \n        n = n1 + n2 \n        return self.to_linked_list(n)\n        \n           ","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers"}
